intro: Columella wrayi, commonly known as the African violet, is a member of the Gesneriaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its velvety, dark green leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a herbaceous perennial, often forming a compact rosette. Its flowers come in a variety of colors, including purple, blue, and white, and are pollinated by insects. Columella wrayi is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
